author: Kristoffersen, Gjert
fulltext:
oai:repo.clarino.uib.no:11509/126;2019-02-25T14:34:17Z;hdl_11509_1;hdl_11509_2;The Level Stress recordings: Älvdalen_90;Kristoffersen, Gjert;Phonology;Recording equipment
The recordings were done by means of a cassette recorder (Sony TC-D5M) and Sony
lavaliere microphones. They were digitized in the 1990s.
The set consists of two speakers, father and grown-up daughter. The original full recordings
have been lost, and they are therefore reconstructed from a series of single files saved into one
wav file.

The speakers
The two speakers, born in 1921 and 1944, were recruited with the help of the Swedish linguist
Gunnar Nyström, who has a thorough knowledge of Dalarna and the Dalarna dialects. At the
time of recording, they lived in the villages of Karlsarvet and Brunnsberg. A third speaker
was also recorded, a man born in 1921, but due to his weak voice, extremely non-fluent
reading and background noise generated by some technical failure, this recording has not been
included in the collection.

For the full background description of this item, see the file "Älvdalen_90: Background.pdf".

For the full description of the whole project, see these files:
     The Level Stress recordings.pdf
     LevelStress_Glossary.pdf
     Level Stress_Speaker and Sound File Codes.pdf

Recording equipment
The recordings were done by means of a cassette recorder (Sony TC-D5M) and Sony
lavaliere microphones. They were digitized in the 1990s.
The set consists of two speakers, father and grown-up daughter. The original full recordings
have been lost, and they are therefore reconstructed from a series of single files saved into one
wav file.

The speakers
The two speakers, born in 1921 and 1944, were recruited with the help of the Swedish linguist
Gunnar Nyström, who has a thorough knowledge of Dalarna and the Dalarna dialects. At the
time of recording, they lived in the villages of Karlsarvet and Brunnsberg. A third speaker
was also recorded, a man born in 1921, but due to his weak voice, extremely non-fluent
reading and background noise generated by some technical failure, this recording has not been
included in the collection.

For the full background description of this item, see the file "Älvdalen_90: Background.pdf".

For the full description of the whole project, see these files:
     The Level Stress recordings.pdf
     LevelStress_Glossary.pdf
     Level Stress_Speaker and Sound File Codes.pdf

The data should be used only for research and development purposes.
title: The Level Stress recordings: Älvdalen_90
